intro: Pultenaea comosa, commonly known as the silky pultenaea, is a small shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and dense clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The leaves are narrow, linear, and covered in fine, silky hairs, giving the plant its common name. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in open forests and woodlands. The plant is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained conditions.
